info.title: IBM Watson Discovery query endpoint
info.description: IBM Watson Discovery simplified API spec for querying.  You can also download the full spec for the entire service by going to https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/discovery-data and clicking on the menu in the upper right.

servers.description: The Watson Discovery URL as specfied in the manage/credentials on IBM Cloud or Cloud Pak for Data

discovery_url.description: The portions of the Watson Discovery URL that follow https://

externalDocs.description: For more information about this service, see docs.

post.description:
Search your data by submitting queries that are written in natural language or formatted in the Discovery Query Language. For more information, see the [Discovery documentation](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-query-concepts). The default query parameters differ by project type. For more information about the project default settings, see the [Discovery documentation](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-query-defaults). See [the Projects API documentation](#create-project) for details about how to set custom default query settings. 

The length of the UTF-8 encoding of the POST body cannot exceed 10,000 bytes, which is roughly equivalent to 10,000 characters in English.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Release date of the version of the API you want to use. Specify dates in YYYY-MM-DD format. The current version is `2020-08-30`.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project. This information can be found from the *Integrate and Deploy* page in Discovery.

400.description:
Bad request.

* Project has no collections.

* A list of document ids is required in **similar.document_ids** when **similar.enabled** is `true`.

source:
import json
from ibm_watson import DiscoveryV2
from ibm_cloud_sdk_core.authenticators import CloudPakForDataAuthenticator

authenticator = CloudPakForDataAuthenticator(
                              '{username}',
                              '{password}',
                              'https://{cpd_cluster_host}{:port}/icp4d-api/v1/authorize',
                               disable_ssl_verification=True)
discovery = DiscoveryV2(
  version='2020-08-30',
  authenticator=authenticator
)
discovery.set_service_url('{https://{cpd_cluster_host}{:port}/discovery/{release}/instances/{instance_id}/api}')

response = discovery.query(
  project_id='{project_id}',
  query='{field:value}'
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(response, indent=2))

collectionIdsParam.name: collection_ids
collectionIdsParam.description: Comma separated list of the collection IDs. If this parameter is not specified, all collections in the project are used.

acFieldParam.name: field
acFieldParam.description: The field in the result documents that autocompletion suggestions are identified from.

acPrefixParam.name: prefix
acPrefixParam.description: The prefix to use for autocompletion. For example, the prefix `Ho` could autocomplete to `hot`, `housing`, or `how`.

acCountParam.name: count
acCountParam.description: The number of autocompletion suggestions to return.

filterParam.name: filter
filterParam.description: Searches for documents that match the Discovery Query Language criteria that is specified as input. Filter calls are cached and are faster than query calls because the results are not ordered by relevance. When used with the `aggregation`, `query`, or `natural_language_query` parameters, the `filter` parameter runs first. This parameter is useful for limiting results to those that contain specific metadata values.

queryParam.name: query
queryParam.description: A query search that is written in the Discovery Query Language and returns all matching documents in your data set with full enrichments and full text, and with the most relevant documents listed first.

nlqParam.name: natural_language_query
nlqParam.description: A natural language query that returns relevant documents by using training data and natural language understanding.

countParam.name: count
countParam.description: Number of results to return. The maximum for the **count** and **offset** values together in any one query is **10,000**

offsetParam.name: offset
offsetParam.description: The number of query results to skip at the beginning. For example, if the total number of results that are returned is 10 and the offset is 8, it returns the last two results. The maximum for the **count** and **offset** values together in any one query is **10000**

docCountParam.name: count
docCountParam.description: The maximum number of documents to return. Up to 1,000 documents are returned by default. The maximum number allowed is 10,000.

QueryLarge.description: An object that represents the query to be submitted.

TableElementLocation.description: The numeric location of the identified element in the document, represented with two integers labeled `begin` and `end`.

QueryResponse.description: A response that contains the documents and aggregations for the query.

matching_results.description: The number of matching results for the query. Results that match due to a curation only are not counted in the total.

results.description: Array of document results for the query.

suggested_query.description: Suggested correction to the submitted **natural_language_query** value.

suggested_refinements.description: Array of suggested refinements. **Note**: The `suggested_refinements` parameter that identified dynamic facets from the data is deprecated.

passages.description: Passages that best match the query from across all of the collections in the project.

QueryResult.description: Result document for the specified query.

document_id.description: The unique identifier of the document.

document_passages.description: Passages from the document that best matches the query.

document_retrieval_source.description: The document retrieval source that produced this search result.

collection_id.description: The collection id associated with this training data set.

confidence.description: The confidence score for the given result. Calculated based on how relevant the result is estimated to be. confidence can range from `0.0` to `1.0`. The higher the number, the more relevant the document. The `confidence` value for a result was calculated using the model specified in the `document_retrieval_strategy` field of the result set. This field is only returned if the **natural_language_query** parameter is specified in the query.

passage_text.description: The content of the extracted passage.

start_offset.description: The position of the first character of the extracted passage in the originating field.

end_offset.description: The position after the last character of the extracted passage in the originating field.

field.description: The label of the field from which the passage has been extracted.

confidence.description: Estimate of the probability that the passage is relevant.

answers.description: An arry of extracted answers to the specified query.

passage_text.description: The content of the extracted passage.

passage_score.description: The confidence score of the passage's analysis. A higher score indicates greater confidence. The score is used to rank the passages from all documents and is returned only if **passages.per_document** is `false`.

document_id.description: The unique identifier of the ingested document.

collection_id.description: The unique identifier of the collection.

start_offset.description: The position of the first character of the extracted passage in the originating field.

end_offset.description: The position after the last character of the extracted passage in the originating field.

field.description: The label of the field from which the passage has been extracted.

confidence.description: An estimate of the probability that the passage is relevant.

answers.description: An array of extracted answers to the specified query.

QueryTableResult.description: A tables whose content or context match a search query.

table_id.description: The identifier for the retrieved table.

source_document_id.description: The identifier of the document the table was retrieved from.

collection_id.description: The identifier of the collection the table was retrieved from.

table_html.description: HTML snippet of the table info.

table_html_offset.description: The offset of the table html snippet in the original document html.

QuerySuggestedRefinement.description: A suggested additional query term or terms user to filter results. **Note**: The `suggested_refinements` parameter is deprecated.

TableHeaders.description: The contents of the current table's header.

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the cell in the current table.

location.description: The location of the table header cell in the current table as defined by its `begin` and `end` offsets, respectfully, in the input document.

text.description: The textual contents of the cell from the input document without associated markup content.

row_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

row_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

column_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

column_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

TableRowHeaders.description: Row-level cells, each applicable as a header to other cells in the same row as itself, of the current table.

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the cell in the current table.

text.description: The textual contents of this cell from the input document without associated markup content.

text_normalized.description: If you provide customization input, the normalized version of the cell text according to the customization; otherwise, the same value as `text`.

row_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

row_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

column_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

column_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

TableKeyValuePairs.description: Key-value pairs detected across cell boundaries.

TableCellKey.description: A key in a key-value pair.

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the key in the table.

text.description: The text content of the table cell without HTML markup.

TableCellValue.description: A list of values in a key-value pair.

TableCellValues.description: A value in a key-value pair.

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the value in the table.

text.description: The text content of the table cell without HTML markup.

TableBodyCells.description: Cells that are not table header, column header, or row header cells

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the cell in the current table.

text.description: The textual contents of this cell from the input document without associated markup content.

row_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

row_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

column_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

column_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

row_header_ids.description: A list of table row header ids

row_header_texts.description: A list of table row header texts

row_header_texts_normalized.description: A list of table row header texts normalized

column_header_ids.description: A list of table column header ids

column_header_texts.description: A list of table column header texts

column_header_texts_normalized.description: A list of table column header texts normalized

text.description: The text associated with the attribute.

TableRowHeaderIds.description: An array of values, each being the `id` value of a row header that is applicable to this body cell.

id.description: The `id` values of a row header.

TableRowHeaderTexts.description: An array of values, each being the `text` value of a row header that is applicable to this body cell.

text.description: The `text` value of a row header.

TableRowHeaderTextsNormalized.description: If you provide customization input, the normalized version of the row header texts according to the customization; otherwise, the same value as `row_header_texts`.

text_normalized.description: The normalized version of a row header text.

TableColumnHeaderIds.description: An array of values, each being the `id` value of a column header that is applicable to the current cell.

id.description: The `id` value of a column header.

TableColumnHeaderTexts.description: An array of values, each being the `text` value of a column header that is applicable to the current cell.

text.description: The `text` value of a column header.

TableColumnHeaderTextsNormalized.description: If you provide customization input, the normalized version of the column header texts according to the customization; otherwise, the same value as `column_header_texts`.

text_normalized.description: The normalized version of a column header text.

TableColumnHeaders.description: Column-level cells, each applicable as a header to other cells in the same column as itself, of the current table.

cell_id.description: The unique ID of the cell in the current table.

location.description: The location of the column header cell in the current table as defined by its `begin` and `end` offsets, respectfully, in the input document.

text.description: The textual contents of this cell from the input document without associated markup content.

text_normalized.description: If you provide customization input, the normalized version of the cell text according to the customization; otherwise, the same value as `text`.

row_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

row_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `row` location in the current table.

column_index_begin.description: The `begin` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

column_index_end.description: The `end` index of this cell's `column` location in the current table.

TableResultTable.description: Full table object retrieved from Table Understanding Enrichment.

text.description: The textual contents of the current table from the input document without associated markup content.

table_headers.description: An array of table-level cells that apply as headers to all the other cells in the current table.

row_headers.description: An array of row-level cells, each applicable as a header to other cells in the same row as itself, of the current table.

column_headers.description: An array of column-level cells, each applicable as a header to other cells in the same column as itself, of the current table.

key_value_pairs.description: An array of key-value pairs identified in the current table.

body_cells.description: An array of cells that are neither table header nor column header nor row header cells, of the current table with corresponding row and column header associations.

contexts.description: An array of lists of textual entries across the document related to the current table being parsed.

TableTextLocation.description: Text and associated location within a table.

QueryLarge.description: Object that describes a long query.

collection_ids.description: A comma-separated list of collection IDs to be queried against.

filter.description: Searches for documents that match the Discovery Query Language criteria that is specified as input. Filter calls are cached and are faster than query calls because the results are not ordered by relevance. When used with the **aggregation**, **query**, or **natural_language_query** parameters, the **filter** parameter runs first. This parameter is useful for limiting results to those that contain specific metadata values.

query.description: A query search that is written in the Discovery Query Language and returns all matching documents in your data set with full enrichments and full text, and with the most relevant documents listed first. Use a query search when you want to find the most relevant search results.

natural_language_query.description: A natural language query that returns relevant documents by using training data and natural language understanding.

aggregation.description: An aggregation search that returns an exact answer by combining query search with filters. Useful for applications to build lists, tables, and time series. For more information about the supported types of aggregations, see the [Discovery documentation](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-query-aggregations).

return.description: A list of the fields in the document hierarchy to return. You can specify both root-level (`text`) and nested (`extracted_metadata.filename`) fields. If this parameter is an empty list, then all fields are returned.

offset.description: The number of query results to skip at the beginning. For example, if the total number of results that are returned is 10 and the offset is 8, it returns the last two results.

sort.description: A comma-separated list of fields in the document to sort on. You can optionally specify a sort direction by prefixing the field with `-` for descending or `+` for ascending. Ascending is the default sort direction if no prefix is specified.

highlight.description: When `true`, a highlight field is returned for each result that contains fields that match the query. The matching query terms are emphasized with surrounding `` tags. This parameter is ignored if **passages.enabled** and **passages.per_document** are `true`, in which case passages are returned for each document instead of highlights.

spelling_suggestions.description: When `true` and the **natural_language_query** parameter is used, the **natural_language_query** parameter is spell checked. The most likely correction is returned in the **suggested_query** field of the response (if one exists).

count.description: Maximum number of tables to return.

suggested_refinements.description:
Configuration for suggested refinements.

**Note**: The **suggested_refinements** parameter that identified dynamic facets from the data is deprecated.

count.description: Maximum number of suggested refinements texts to be returned. The maximum is `100`.

enabled.description: A passages query that returns the most relevant passages from the results.

per_document.description:
If `true`, ranks the documents by document quality, and then returns the highest-ranked passages per document in a `document_passages` field for each document entry in the results list of the response.

If `false`, ranks the passages from all of the documents by passage quality regardless of the document quality and returns them in a separate `passages` field in the response.

max_per_document.description: Maximum number of passages to return per document in the result. Ignored if **passages.per_document** is `false`.

fields.description: A list of fields to extract passages from. If this parameter is an empty list, then all root-level fields are included.

count.description: The maximum number of passages to return. Ignored if **passages.per_document** is `true`.

characters.description: The approximate number of characters that any one passage will have.

find_answers.description:
When true, `answer` objects are returned as part of each passage in the query results. The primary difference between an `answer` and a `passage` is that the length of a passage is defined by the query, where the length of an `answer` is calculated by Discovery based on how much text is needed to answer the question.

This parameter is ignored if passages are not enabled for the query, or no **natural_language_query** is specified.

If the **find_answers** parameter is set to `true` and **per_document** parameter is also set to `true`, then the document search results and the passage search results within each document are reordered using the answer confidences. The goal of this reordering is to place the best answer as the first answer of the first passage of the first document. Similarly, if the **find_answers** parameter is set to `true` and **per_document** parameter is set to `false`, then the passage search results are reordered in decreasing order of the highest confidence answer for each document and passage.

The **find_answers** parameter is available only on managed instances of Discovery.

max_answers_per_passage.description: The number of `answer` objects to return per passage if the **find_answers** parmeter is specified as `true`.

similar.description: Finds results from documents that are similar to documents of interest. Use this parameter to add a *More like these* function to your search. You can include this parameter with or without a **query**, **filter** or **natural_language_query** parameter.

enabled.description: When `true`, includes documents in the query results that are similar to documents you specify.

document_ids.description: The list of documents of interest. Required if **enabled** is `true`.

fields.description: Looks for similarities in the specified subset of fields in the documents. If not specified, all of the document fields are used.

RetrievalDetails.description: An object contain retrieval type information.

document_retrieval_strategy.description:
Identifies the document retrieval strategy used for this query. `relevancy_training` indicates that the results were returned using a relevancy trained model. 

**Note**: In the event of trained collections being queried, but the trained model is not used to return results, the **document_retrieval_strategy** is listed as `untrained`.

ResultPassageAnswer.description: Object that contains a potential answer to the specified query.

answer_text.description: Answer text for the specified query as identified by Discovery.

start_offset.description: The position of the first character of the extracted answer in the originating field.

end_offset.description: The position after the last character of the extracted answer in the originating field.

confidence.description: An estimate of the probability that the answer is relevant.
